page.title: 03Oundle Middle School
page.content: There are 22 classrooms in Oundle Middle School. They teach a large range of subjects. They have twenty five children in a class. The school was opened in 1980 and cost one million pounds to build. They have two large playgrounds and a big games field. They play games like netball, rugby, soccer, hockey, basketball, cricket, tennis, swimming, table tennis, rounders, athletics and gymnastics. There is a library with 8,5OO books that the children read a lot. They have 10 BBC Computers that they use quite a lot. The school also has a large kitchen and very nice school dinners. They have a nice entrance with carpets. It cost ten thousand pounds a year to heat. There is a new garden and greenhouse and some pets for the children to look after. They have a nature site down by the river.
